messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, bpuzon <rexiu@...> wrote:
>
>
> Now I've got sth like that:
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @SuiteClasses({package1.AllTests.class, package2.AllTests.class})
> class MasterTest {}
>
> And in packages 1 and 2:
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @SuiteClasses({...})
> public class AllTests {}
>
> All my tests are derived from an abstract class with @BeforeClass.
And
> @BeforeClass is still being run more than once for testing
process :/ (I'm
> asking Eclipse to run MasterTest()).
>


Maybe you can try this:

@RunWith(MySuite.class)
@SuiteClasses({package1.AllTests.class, package2.AllTests.class})
public class MySuite extends Suite {
public static Connection connection=null;
static {
connection=SomeDataSource.getConnection();
}
public MySuite(Class<?> klass) throws InitializationError {
super(klass);
}
}

This is work in eclipse,but I'm not sure it is work in ant or maven
etc.

Regards.
